com.bookworm.controllers

Class BookController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bookworm.controllers.BookController

  • @RestController
 @Scope(value="singleton")
 @RequestMapping(value="/books")
public class BookController
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that handles all basic book API endpoints GET, POST and DELETE.
    Since:
    1.7

      • saveBook

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                consumes="application/json",
                produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Book> saveBook(@Validated @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                        Book book)
        Used to save one book to the database. Format: { "authors": [ {"authorId": 1}, {"authorId": 2} ], "publisher": { "publisherId": 1 }, "title": "test", "description": "Selitysta", "genre": "Java", "format": "Kovakantinen", "price": 5, "stock": 15, "pages": 666, "isbn": "2340980293" }
        Parameters:
        book -
        Returns:
        the saved book.

      • buyBook

        @Transactional
 @RequestMapping(value="/{bookId}/buy",
                method=PUT,
                consumes="application/json",
                produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Purchase> buyBook(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   long bookId,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   int amount)
        Buy the book with the given id. Reduces book's stock, adds history about the payment to the purhcase history.
        Parameters:
        bookId - book's id.
        amount - the amount of books bought.
        Returns:
        purhcase history.

      • addStockForBook

        @Transactional
 @RequestMapping(value="/{bookId}/add_stock",
                method=PUT,
                consumes="application/json",
                produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Book> addStockForBook(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             long bookId,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             int amount)
        Adds stock to the given book. Also checks for any notifications left by users and sends email for those who have left notification.
        Parameters:
        bookId - books'id id.
        amount - the amount of increased stock.
        Returns:
        the targeted book.
